item.title: Bitcoin Catches On With Gold Bugs
item.description:
Bitcoin Catches On With Gold Bugs

Kanishka Sukumar, a consultant who works in midtown Manhattan, says his parents often stash money in gold for safekeeping. But the 24-year-old thinks there is a better place for his savings. "In times of financial turmoil, I would prefer to see a portfolio full of bitcoin," said Mr. Sukumar, who holds about one-third of his wealth in the...

item.title: Can Bitcoin coexist with Ethereum or are they purely competitive?
item.description:

item.title: Are people and businesses now switching their focus from Bitcoin to Ethereum?
item.description:
Are people and businesses now switching their focus from Bitcoin to Ethereum?

Sony Corp. of America v. Universal City Studios, Inc. , also known as the "Betamax case". In a 5-4 ruling, the Court ruled that using home video recording devices such as Betamax or VCR's to make individual recordings of television shows to watch at one's convenience is not copyright infringement and therefore the manufacturers of such devices cannot be held liable for infringement.

item.title: Lisk Gears Up for May 24th Launch - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Lisk Gears Up for May 24th Launch - Bitcoinist.net

After a 5 month-long period of development, fundraising and community-building, Lisk is set to launch on May 24, 2016.

item.title: Bitcoin Miner Fees and Micropayment Channels - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Miner Fees and Micropayment Channels - NEWSBTC

The average bitcoin transaction fee currently stands at 10280 satoshis. Micropayment channels can drastically reduce transaction costs for multiple bitcoin transactions across 2 parties. The Bitcoin network is weighed down by increasing number of transactions over the blockchain. Thanks to the smaller block size of 1 MB, which has not been upgraded since the days of Bitcoin's creation.

item.title: EP #81: Ned Scott explains Steem.it!
item.description:
EP #81: Ned Scott explains Steem.it!

On today's show I welcome Ned Scott, the CEO of Steemit. Ned talks to us about the value of Community and the value of reputation - two vitally important concepts that lie at the heart of Steemit. Working with the Larimers, Ned is blazing a trail forward and setting a great example of how we can learn to communicate better in the future.

item.title: A Centralized Blockchain Solution Will Not Solve Financial Fraud
item.description:
A Centralized Blockchain Solution Will Not Solve Financial Fraud

Anyone who has been paying to the financial ecosystem over the past few months will have noticed how a lot of institutions are turning to the blockchain for additional security. That statement was only reinforced by a recent Bloomberg article, as the mounting fraud in traditional finance needs to be addressed sooner rather than later.

item.title: WhatsApp Payment Service Holds Implications for Bitcoin Adoption
item.description:
WhatsApp Payment Service Holds Implications for Bitcoin Adoption

Indian E-Commerce site Also read: Bitcoin Pizza Day's Sixth Anniversary! FreeCharge has partnered with WhatsApp to provide payment services directly through the WhatsApp chat application. FreeCharge made the announcement on May 20th, 2016 that they were adding their new feature to the messaging app to enable payment services.

item.title: How Is Ether Being Used By Ethereum Users?
item.description:
How Is Ether Being Used By Ethereum Users?

Similar to Bitcoin, Ethereum enthusiasts will use Ether to pay for transactions and split bills among one another. Ethereum has been getting a lot of attention in recent times, yet it remains unclear as to why people use this cryptocurrency so often.

item.title: Does ethereum (ether) use SHA-256?
item.description:
Does ethereum (ether) use SHA-256?
